title: Journal of Information Technology & Politics
text: The Journal of Information Technology & Politics is a quarterly <a href="peer-reviewed">peer-reviewed</a> <a href="academic%20journal">academic journal</a> that was established in 2004 by <a href="Haworth%20Press">Haworth Press</a> as the "Journal of E-Government". It obtained its current name in 2007 when the journal switched to <a href="Routledge">Routledge</a>. It is an official journal of the section on Information Technology & Politics of the <a href="American%20Political%20Science%20Association">American Political Science Association</a>. The <a href="editor-in-chief">editor-in-chief</a> is Stuart W. Shulman (<a href="University%20of%20Massachusetts%20Amherst">University of Massachusetts Amherst</a>). The journal covers research on the interaction of <a href="information%20technology">information technology</a> with political and governmental processes. It is abstracted and indexed by <a href="Scopus">Scopus</a>.
